name: lubricated
content:

informal having drunk alcohol, especially when this makes someone behave in a more open and friendly way: By the end of the night, everyone was well lubricated. There will be a bar open all day to keep you lubricated between bands. Related words
lubricate
lubrication
More examplesFewer examplesThe fans had gone to the pub early to get lubricated before the game.As the night wore on, tongues became more lubricated. Reporters tend to gossip and, when lubricated, often reveal too much.I know you don't want to drink, but you can come with me while I get lubricated.
